description: This document verifies that EBS volumes on the launched instance are accessible, identical to the source, and properly mounted on the EC2 instance.

Volumes.description: (Required) List of all volumes to verify (for example: [{"deviceName": "/dev/xvda", "totalStorageBytes": 8589934592}])

runCommand:
#!/bin/bash
GB=$((1024 * 1024 * 1024))

function parse_volumes_json () {
  pyexec=python3
  which python3 > /dev/null 2>&1
  is_py3=$?
  if [ $is_py3 -eq 1 ]; then pyexec=python; fi
  $pyexec - <<END
import json
data = json.loads('{{Volumes}}')
for d in data:
  print(d['deviceName'] + '-' + str(d['totalStorageBytes']))
END
}

function normalize_size () {
  echo $(awk -v size_bytes="$1" -v GB="$GB" 'BEGIN {
    res = size_bytes / GB
    if (res % 1 != 0) {
      res += 0.5
    }
    printf "%.0f", res
  }')
}

user_disks=($(parse_volumes_json))

if [ "$?" -ne "0" ]; then
  echo "Error: failed to parse Volumes"
  exit 1
fi

readarray -t lsblk_disks_output_arr < <(lsblk -d -e 7 --noheadings -b -o NAME,SIZE)
system_disks_count="${#lsblk_disks_output_arr[@]}"
user_disks_count="${#user_disks[@]}"

if [ "$system_disks_count" -ne "$user_disks_count" ]; then
  echo "Error: found #$system_disks_count disks, expected #$user_disks_count"
  exit 1
fi

for i in "${!user_disks[@]}"; do
  IFS="-" read -r name sizeBytes <<< "${user_disks[$i]}"
  sizeGb=$(normalize_size "$sizeBytes")
  user_disks[$i]="$name-$sizeGb"
done

declare -a system_disks

for disk in "${lsblk_disks_output_arr[@]}"; do
  IFS=" " read -r name sizeBytes <<< "$disk"
  sizeGb=$(normalize_size "$sizeBytes")
  system_disks+=("$name-$sizeGb")
done

ret=0

for user_disk in "${user_disks[@]}"; do
  IFS="-" read -r user_disk_name user_disk_size <<< "$user_disk"
  found=0
  for i in "${!system_disks[@]}"; do

    IFS="-" read -r system_disk_name system_disk_size <<< "${system_disks[$i]}"
    if [ "$user_disk_size" == "$system_disk_size" ]; then
      echo "Success: disk $user_disk_name is found"
      unset 'system_disks[$i]'
      found=1
      break
    fi
  done

  if [ "$found" -eq "0" ]; then
    echo "Error: disk $user_disk_name is not found"
    ret=1
  fi
done

exit $ret
